intro: Psilocaulon planisepalum, commonly known as the flat-sepal psilocaulon, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Campanulaceae. It is characterized by its simple, lance-shaped leaves and small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale blue in color. The plant is native to certain regions of South America, particularly in the Andean foothills. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded, forested areas. Due to its unique floral structure and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
